UlP3dVSKmeRHC_tH9Qc26g.text: Went here a few times back in the day when I studied in London. It's a great bar that's even more fun if you go on St. Patty's day. Not only that, but the place is awesome with all its rooms, stairs and cut outs. I totally recommend it.

BzFT4z1S2CxF94J6pVbTxg.text: Good steak and guiness pie.  This place has a really fun combination of decors - old-fashioned church pews and a giant tree.  It's a good place for a pub meal or just drinks.  Friendly bartenders and fun atmosphere.

nwF3Ph11yM-K1gawXvBVxQ.text: very cool layout with different themed rooms.Very visually arresting; there is a cathedral room, a cottage room, and a giant tree!I would recommend it to anyone even if they only stop in for one drink.

wTGm8JgtrRY6xz5dr_QQvQ.text: This is a very fun pub, and I'm not sure whether anyone's mentioned this yet but there's a great big tree in the middle of it!  The decor is all done in wood and there's really something to look at wherever you go.  (There's a virtual tour on their website to give you an idea of the look of the place.)I stopped in here early on a Friday evening, around 6pm.  It was already fairly crowded, but not so much that I felt overwhelmed.   There are a few different areas, each with tables and a bar, and finding your way around the winding corners and staircases feels a bit like playing around in a very elaborate tree house (that also happens to smell like beer).  Aside from the angry-looking man who stood next to me at the bar staring at his Blackberry, the clientele seemed quite fun and not obnoxious.  (Again, though, I was there around 6pm on a Friday, so things might be different later!)  It's big and there are a lot of rooms, but I didn't find it confusing.  It's affordable and fun for a change of scenery.  Decidedly worth checking out!

EvLNWDIt_ZlQfCYorUxgQA.text: The drinks are standard, as is the food. But the place does have a great atmosphere! As you step down from the main bar you're greated with a large tree and the further you explore the further down the rabbit hole you go into a maze of caverns and side bars. Always great to take out of towners to for a pub with a twist!

IAtKnN-_ZjOc0ol21C0Qpw.text: This place is very unassuming for the outside, but inside it is huge!The decor is great, has a real casual pub feeling with lots of different floors and corners to hang out, and great party music.My only minor downside is that on saturday night they really need more bar staff at the downstairs bar.... it took ages to get a drink.

24fIR3HisH0EGwspbe-jTw.text: This place isn't as awful as you expect it to be. The hoards of tourists that you anticipate are definitely there, but the building is huge so it doesn't feel crammed and you can easily find a private table to hang out with your friends. The food is okay. The drinks could be more expensive. It basically feels like a very non-confrontational approach to being a pub: it is large, but cozy enough; you get what you expect from the food without being either wowed or disappointed; the beer is predictable, but it's still beer. Basically, nothing overwhelmingly fantastic or disappointing. I would go back, but I'm not yearning to. I'm not opposed to it, either. It's all very Goldilocks.

1BKfvZ0nZOZDe5ZalmVpAA.text: I have been here a couple of times and always forget to write a review. Despite the fact that this pub is in touristy  Soho you will find many locals here. Its a great place to watch a football match as well as to just go to hang out with friends and in big groups. The pub is really busy though, so if you're a bigger group I would reserve a table. Finding people here is tricky though as there are multiple levels, corners, and rooms. The atmosphere here is great though, prices are ok, and the fact that they play shitty 90s music is amazing :) Plus with all the different tube lines it is also convenient, as everyone will find a way to get home.

K4NTgRlxD3x7oE0j3vusJA.text: A bit touristy, but a really big, traditional British pub.They've got a huge network of rooms underground with big screens, and even a big tree. There's a lot of people here, and the food is pretty good though not the best I've had.

FFUl1qGNgrNZuxkb12AukA.text: I like Waxys - drinks are a little pricey and it does tend to get crowded but if you arrive early and grab a nice corner or booth it's lovely! :-)Great when there's live music on too - I dont know how frequently they have live music but I somehow manage to time my visits with it!The only main issue I have with Waxys is how many different levels and areas it has... I had planned to meet some online friends there (some i hadnt met or seen photos of before) and the many levels made it difficult to keep us all in one place!!Nikki x

DswcHa6BJ_kLrLr_qCADUQ.text: Best Irish pub. I am here with friends every other weekend and we have a great time. Maybe you should upload some photos to your qype page so everyone can see the awesome decor and atmosphere in the place.Also, there is a pretty wide selection of brews.

w4yxsVchfnhWWy5A85WG9A.text: I like this pub because of its architecture. There are a lot of small places to talk, drink or just sit down an enjoy. The huge tree in the middle of the pub makes it very special. I have to go there every time I am in London.

BBpWd2OXUJUFLnLUyGlk6A.text: I love Lord of the Rings and the first time I came to Waxy's i was like whoa. I feel like i'm in a tree. this is cool.  there's tons of different rooms, lots of drunk irish people, and an all round good time.  Also, considering its in Leicester Sq/ Picadilly area it does well to not fall into all the same crap around that area.

-4_iR-r80Kq3OzmzBLrE4w.text: So, when in London visit an Irish Pub? For me, yes. I was in London on business and main reason for visiting Waxy's was that they advertised an evening a live Irish session music, which always means that I will be there. The facility is huge, by my experience at least, and the subterranean feel makes it difficult to easily get around the place, but it was fun. Sitting down to enjoy the music I started up a conversation with the bartender and that was pleasant. My only negative issue is that the room was blazing hot - no idea why? To make the guests thirsty?

zI0uzZ7P_FhGLvGffGbx9g.text: I was, it can be only said, on a time-out from the Dublin club-scene back in 92 I think it was, and as I was walking down Shaftsbury Avenue, not necessarily looking for a job, but in need of one , when I spotted this place in progress, went in and applied and opened it a couple of weeks later, with a bunch of Irish, that put a lot of work and love into the place. Frank Ennis, architect (who designed 'the Kerryman' in Chicago more recently), turned a massive space, into a church-like zoo, for over-grown children to get lost in. About 6/7 bars and nooks and crannies galore.The massive tree seemingly growing up from out of the middle of the main bar, giving it all the theatrics of a Peter Pan tale! I can barely remember 'Waxy' the opening Gm's name, but I think it was Neil, and he was dead sound, as was his cousin. Rayleen was a manager and Martin too, though we didnt get on till later back in Dublin. It was too busy for too much messing! ;) This pub was later used as a business model for bars across America e.g Fado Irish Pubs, and it was not long until it was the highest grossing bar in Britain (no wonder they opened another version down the road) So if youre going to export the craic (fun) from home, then this is the spot! This is how it's structured at least, but on a return there recently, the crowd still does the rest, whether Irish or not!Warning: It's not a spot you go on your own for a quiet pint from Thurs to Sun at least!

RxI-M3-qTUOgnHsFQtXXVA.text: I love this bar!If you are not a fan of the Irish Theme Pubs that seem to be cropping up in London, you need to grin and bear the fiddle music!- It is really worth going to!.A labrynth like the Porterhouse in Covent Garden, with a great interior.  Its like you have entered into a bar in Lord of The Rings!With various tree branches, everything is made of wood and at all different leves, it does feel like you are inside a Tree!A great night out!

r18GNVJanegxBXGLsM2Ueg.text: Go for the O'Connor's, stay for the Waxy. That's not really their motto, it just sounds good. I am going to try and license it to them as an even trade in Murphy's Irish Stout. To this day, I contest that Murphy's is better than Guinness. I get a lot of hate on this, but that's just cause most people haven't had the experience that is a pint of Murphy's Stout.From outside, this looks like any old quasi-Irish pub. When you get inside, it looks slightly bigger. But if you stay in the front, ground floor bar, you are missing what makes this place phenomenal. Towards the back there is an open labyrinth of seats, stairs, bars, and a giant TREE. This is no prop tree, this is the real thing, alive and functioning. It makes the place the greatness that it deserves to be. Pints are affordable, they have mixed drinks and a very tasty pub grub menu. I had the BBQ Bacon Burger with chips and it was one of the best, if not the best I've had in London. This place is hopping on most nights of the week, with a good amount of revelers on the weekends. My original concern was that it was so close to the tourist traps of Piccadilly, but once you get past the stink and filth of Piccadilly Circus, this place is just out of the way enough to make it a destination and not just a "let's go here" pub. They have an upstairs that overlooks a good part of the bar for private parties. Also, when there isn't a live band (Sundays feature an awesome Irish band), the juke box will be blasting mostly American rock, with the occassional Clash, Oasis and other Brit bands thrown in for measure. I will be back soon and often!

61fk1mFayCgAGiLGqjjscw.text: Fabulous atmosphere. You step inside and it's like a whole magical world with multi-level seating areas with this crazy tree with a ton of branches in the center. Top 40 pop songs play in the background. Packed but was able to find seating for our party on a Sunday night. Saw two couples making out, too, under the hazy yellow lighting.

Qmwduzf0wLFE4qHQ-3e-Ww.text: I'll be the last Irishman to sing the praises of the now global phenomenon of plastic Paddy bars. Dotting up from Doha to Dunedin, these silly places are invariably called Hooligan's, play unending fiddle-dee-dee music and are staffed entirely by locals without two words of Irish to knock together nor the skill to leave a stout settle properly. Sampling Irish-ness (whatever that is) in one of these so-called Irish bars is sort of like expecting to realise some universal zen on the sushi conveyor at Yo!   Rant finished, I grudgingly acknowledge that Waxy O'Connor's (yes, another silly name) is one of the better examples of globalised Oirish fakeness. The bouncers are surprisingly nice, the timber interior is atmospherically cavernous, the place is always rammed with real-life GAA-jersey wearing jackeens, and the Guinness is passable. It's not quite like being transported to a misty bog bar in Roscommon, but perhaps as close to the buzz of an after work Friday in Temple Bar or Rathmines as you'll find anywhere off the old sod.

Ru0EGCVxfRyq-at0wLIJpg.text: Pretty bummed this outranks De Hems so I'm going to give it a harsh review. This is nothing more that another touristy Irish theme bar in above average surroundings. Anyone who knows London deserves to do better than this. Personally I'd rather go to the O'Neils around the corner, at least that has a dance floor and doesn't have ideas above its station. Having a tree in the middle of the pub doesn't make it interesting... unless you come from Wigan. I used to enjoying drinking here when I was 17 / 18, which says it all really.

sXJ4JPY4mLx9VyY_IH9bXA.text: A great irish bar. A bit of a warren of a place but there's always a great atmosphere here particularly when there's a game on - so many tvs and big screens. The food is tastey and reasonable enough on the pocket while it has all the usual you'd expect at a bar. A plus point for any irish out there is that they sell toyto crisps - which in itself is deserving of the five star rating.

v7UPa8BoWBFIy04N5lyOfA.text: Ahhh, after reading Josephine B's review on Waxy's it was ingrained in my brain to visit it again - I used to go there so often when I was a student and always had a great time!Now this is not a traditional Irish pub - how could it be? It's in the middle of Central London - in Soho! It's a fun Irish themed pub directed at a fun laid back crowd. From the outside, it's just a couple of doors into a pub but if you go in there, it is MASSIVE & pretty cool!The interior is wooden and the theme is 'Church'. There are so many corners and cubby holes, chairs that are like church seats, areas that look like a confessional box!  balconies over looking the whole pub and signs pointing you in different directions in case you get lost! There is also a beautiful huge tree in the middle of the pub too!The bar is well stocked, the music is main stream and the crowd is a nice after work/ tourists/local crowd - good mix.There is another pub called 'Waxy's little sister'around the corner too.It gets really busy at the weekends so I recommend checking it out during the week!I've never had a crap time here, it's not COOL as such but it is alot of silly fun! Recommend!!

uUXyl_YSL7XjzBi24xYA0Q.text: waxy o'connor's is one of the biggest pubs in london, conveniently located in the heart of the west end. it's worth visiting at least once to see the gigantic tree that seems to be propping up the centre of the building, but for such a large establishment it manages to be fairly friendly too.Brilliant rabbit-warren of old wooden rooms with bars on various levels - a great place to spend a dark wintery night... if you can find a seat!

Ob0AKFoNRH43I0F_cA_1sw.text: This pub is massive, so many levels, steps, doors, tables. chair, and bars.  It can take a little while to find your perfect spot to hang out in. This place is so cool we lost track of time and spent a few good hours here drinking beer and eating chips. The atmosphere is great, at the time we were here a futball game was playing in the main tree room. Everyone was yelling and having a grand time. Service at the bar was fast and our chips came out pretty quickly. Great place to just chill out and enjoy looking at the walls.

LHu3ojlIoTJ6XBNMYyQZ_Q.text: This is an excellent, fun, and lively pub just off the main thoroughfare of Piccadilly Circus. It's vast, with several different bars - and many different rooms and nooks to hang out and enjoy a drink or pint alone, or with friends. The decorum is beautiful, the scene is lively, and on my visit during a Friday night - it was a grand time! Highly recommended.

tOAKmn6rWgMMsbNXjb2cNA.text: Cool place but the service was awful. Might have been a bad shift because I have been there before and it was quite good; but after my last experience I don't think there will be a next one.

7D--7GFf-xJJRV7wLwlCQQ.text: I love the atmosphere. You'd swear you were in some kind of combination church and hobbit hole. It's all twisty turny passages, nooks and crannies, and places to tuck away into a corner. We came here for beers on a weekday night and service was quick, the bar was efficient, and we found a table that held 8 of us with no trouble. If there's a downside to Waxy's it's the layout. I gotta believe that after you've had a few beers it can be hard to find your way out! Mind your step.

eBXM9D7XeUoM68bK72karA.text: Dark cool spot for a drink on a hot day! Several little coves for drinking in this subterranean bar. The vibe is cool, but perhaps a bit touristy. Don't expect many real ales on tap, just the usual. Definitely a sports pub, you won't have any problems finding a good spot to watch the TV. The volume is quite loud as well!

jMF13OcS7E5EM-qoRl8DjQ.text: I really do not understand the fascination of this place. it is about as authentic as Glenfiddich from China. The surroundings look cheap and plasticy, the music is loud and blarring and it is located right next to Leicester Square, attracting all these lovely people (not).

TaOdcjYB8vgZiyMiXWYbCQ.text: Probably fun if already drunk but not so fun for a midday lunch and drink.Inedible food.  Couldn't finish my baguette as the bread was so tasteless and the meat was so stale.  Irish breakfast was a little better, with a nice grilled mushroom and tomato to lighten up the black pudding and sausage.  Decent selection of Irish whiskeys and cool LOTR decor, but service is spotty.Not worth slogging through all the tourist shit in Piccadilly Circus unless you're trying to pick up hobbits.

CaS3CKfHvAr1SfsusyBwyg.text: Are you people all out of your minds? There's nothing "traditional" about this place at all.  It's an oversized faux-Irish pub that blares horrible music so loudly that it feels more like a club than a pub.  Even if I was still a single hormone-crazed 23 year-old then I'd think that this place sucked, because it would be impossible to pick up chicks here (the primary motivation of 90% of the men in this bar), since women don't really enjoy it when you have to scream "WHAT'S YOUR NAME?" in to their ear.Oh yeah - it's also in Piccadilly Circus, which doubles the suck factor.

dG1tJR8UITCZDPQaPFgN8g.text: It's good if you like getting drunk I suppose, but I don't like it much. Interesting layout, reasonable drinks selection, but I am not a fan of the atmosphere and it either feels really cramped or really empty. Either way there's rarely anywhere to sit. There's also no mobile phone signal inside, making it hard to coordinate if you have friends arriving there to meet you. The tree is kind of cool though so it's worth going there just for that.

NfjMyFl7-KyD6_dibYrbVQ.text: Holy Dancing Irishmen, Batman!Waxy's has got to be one of the most fun pubs in all of England.  Cheesy music aside (was that really Lionel Richie I heard?!  And Abba?  And the Macarena?) this place delivers the ultimate pub experience.  You'll get your share of well dressed "unwinding after work" businessmen, party animal Irishmen (always entertaining) and everything in between.  The crowd is obviously here for a good time, and despite Waxy's popularity (it was PACKED on Friday night) it is surprisingly laid-back.   The atmosphere (you're in a huge tree house!) is cool because there are upwards of 5 rooms, all with a slightly different personality to them.  This is the kind of pub where a visit will leave you with lots of good stories to tell.   The only downside is that it gets so busy in the main room (where the DJ is) that it can take forever to get a drink... but I guess that just means more time for irresponsible flirting!

U6ub-foc2PM97GB_U6-y-w.text: Hard to find a seat so be prepared for a busy pub and bad club music.

TrwDm5oiDaNJiS3NS22Pnw.text: Wow this place is crazy. It has a tree?You feel like you're drinking in some underground fantasy pub from the world of the Borrowers. Or maybe you should have oversized shoeless feet to be in here? Have tankards the size of your head? I don't know. I do know every time I come in here I suspend my disbelief and enjoy myself.Not the cheapest this, a pub not for every Friday or Saturday night, but it is for those occasions when you want to go for something a little different in central London. Amazingly, it manages to repel the twunts that circle the rest of Leicester Sq and Picadilly.It can get very busy in here at the main bar but I recommend squirrelling yourself away upstairs for the more authentic experience.

UMFytnCKVszOhCHyuKJfBg.text: We really enjoy drinks in Waxy's when we are near Char X, the interior is like something out of Hogwarts, you go through a little door on one side of the street (or the main entrance the road over) and down some stairs into a maze of seating areas and bars including an area with an awesome wooden tree in the middle of it! Has a great atmosphere although can get very busy, the main negative though is a slight bone of contention as we enjoyed my birthday here a year or so ago, we paid a fifty quid reservation deposit which was promised as to be returned as a bar tab but it was quite uncomfortable (paticularly for my bday) that when my husband asked to use the bar tab they seemed confused and reluctant to give us the bar tab wanting proof of payment? Eventually (be warned getting signal here is tricky) he managed to bring up the confirmation email prooving he had paid! So be aware if booking to take a printed email as the staff might not be told, overal a great place to hang tho!

DVgx0CngeTDwpEQTQuViqg.text: Coolest pub ever!  Feels like a different world inside!! Great variety of Ciders.

boxzTwdlcJGiwqienGVwOg.text: If someone blindfolded me, took me on a plane and shoved me in a booth in Waxy O'Connor's, I would open my eyes and insist that we were at the Epcot Center next to Disneyland. Of course, I would be wrong, but I would still be in the tourist trap that is PIccadilly Center, which isn't far off. My roommates and I went tonight and though it wasn't a bad experience at all, it wasn't exactly a place I'd want to return for any reason. The Irish Stew was good and my friend said her stuffed chicken was delicious but it looked a bit heavy.

DUVBaAdj2f4d289Bq74BYA.text: When people talk about this place, it's usually known as the place with the big tree inside it. Nothing special on the outside, but inside is a different story. It is set over a few floors, with different rooms named as such things as Tree Room, Cottage Bar, Church Bar and the Pink Room. The interior is a melange of all sorts: Brick walls, wooden ceilings, a random array of wooden furniture. It got quite packed when I went, and I wasn't feeling too well that day, but was cheered up when I was offered a very good cup...or two, or three of Hot Toddy, and I even started to feel a lot better.

photos.caption: Photo of Waxy O'Connor's - London, United Kingdom

YI1_TwZPqPpql5N3o2vRPw.text: While cruising the streets of Soho on a Friday afternoon, a good friend and I started to discuss the matter of a good pub lunch. Our idea came to fruition in the form of Waxy O' Connors. The pub's meek entrance belies the true stature of the place: it magically opens up onto a stunning, warm, multi-level pub with intricate woodwork, old concrete floors and stained glass windows. It feels quite authentic in its oldness so you half expect someone to walk in wearing a full suit of armour. Seating was comfortable and the menu interesting, both of us settling for a smoked salmon sandwich and a cider. The food was excellent, though getting it proved to be slightly problematic. It's clear a lot of work and fine-tuning has helped create this pub and its almost biblical atmosphere, but what a pity the response to my food order from the person standing at the till was "I'm on my break." Thankfully, good company in great surroundings proved to be the real winner at the end of the day.

photos.caption: Photo of Waxy O'Connor's - London, United Kingdom. Waxy Small Entrance

WPzVQRsOrv37ksRygfmOeQ.text: This pub is pretty awesome due to its labyrinth layout - I'm pretty sure I've yet to discover every little hideout at this place. Stairs go up, down, round, behind and who knows where else - all leading to...well seats - but seats are good! One of the rooms has a little fire place which gives it a nice homey  feel. While the massive tree in the middle, makes you feel like you're in a fantasy world or forest pub haha. Definitely worth a visit if you haven't experienced it for yourself. It can  get ridiculously busy (especially if there's some sort of sport on) and it isn't the cheapest place to drink, but if you fancy something a little different - check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Waxy O'Connor's - London, United Kingdom. The fireplace

u6c-KmH5Jqln9eOM8SSsyg.text: Located just off of Leicester Square and Chinatown, this pub looks like it's straight out of a Harry Potter film! You walk inside and it's a never ending maze of staircases and different sections of the pub. It's decorated in what I can only describe as a medieval fantasy world. It wasn't too busy either and we got served at the bar almost instantly! Good music, good vibes and a quirky little pub in the heart of London!

TVpkwyyl0shqXXY5lwoScA.text: We stumbled upon Waxy while in search of a good English pub and a nice beer. Upon first inspection, Waxy seems small. But alas! Go down the stairs and you'll find that the pub actually has several areas further underground. There are a total of 3 bars, so you can indulge your inner, or outer, alcoholic. To be honest, the source of my fascination was not in the amount of ciders they have on tap, but rather, I felt like I was in Middle Earth and expected to see Legolas deftly descend from the ceiling at any second.

oZ1k8HVOSn-fPRxbkJSZhw.text: Lovely pub, with a consistent theme throughout. It even has a "tree" inside (it's plastic really). The day I was there there was absolutely no chance of a seat, and I got the impression this was normal. Lovely atmosphere though.

RvuyQZaW2sWoz0_mdc205A.text: Are you looking to infect yourself with an STD so you can get £££ from some NHS-sponsored study while serving as a scientific guinea pig? Please, don't wait to visit Waxy's! Plenty of strains to choose from - and plenty of places to get infected!The toilets are flooded, the service attendant doesn't give a shit, and a cockroach weaves in and out between feet at the main bar at midnight! They've got it all!* Waxy's will even throw in a free show of drunk douche-bags jamming along to the "Macarena" at the front door! Seriously folks, come one, come all! You're missing out on one hell of an unhygienic, freaky Friday night in London!*£10 minimum card purchase on all drinks.

YaEALUzS-zMKkePcPZjoFg.text: This watering "hole" is a must to  visit.I agree with Catherine as the scene does look like it is straight out a Harry Potter film. It also is a bit touristy. But the scene and for "people watching" it's amazing.  I had several beers with a couple co workers and staff  last Friday night. I definitely will be back.

tsd1ELxrbWVWh0A6cg6OAw.text: A lovely labyrinth inside! I only wish there was also a lovely labyrinth of beers for my taste buds to navigate rather than the usual blah suds. Guinness was my best option. Still, worth a visit to see the inside, and for its central location. Haven't tried any food, but the menu looked like your average pub fare.

Jz1G-bhNdE2zRN_WtkDr3g.text: This was probably one of my favorite places in London and one of the best meals I had. The music is very NYC in the the early 2000's, late 1990's and the crowd is hip 20 year old with some tourists and implants. The only reason I don't give this place 5 stars was because the bartender was a little bit rude.

dxbHWH0U2QKxZc9glRKGFg.text: Fun pub for foreigners because of the labyrinth like wooden interior. We were early so service was decent. When we returned later it got very crowded. Not our thing, but if that is what you're looking for you'll have a ball.

0TydZrM5pkHZ6C8lzGrVfw.text: I brought my friend here, expecting to relax and talk... it turns out the music was so loud like a club that we ended up leaving after a drink.  No one was dancing on a Saturday night, yet it was nothing like a typical Irish pub.I'd give some stars for the interesting architecture of an old underground church.  It's very specious with many rooms, a cool place for a quick visit.

T9pXE4oB6d4qRYAQKjnd6g.text: I actually went to Waxy's back in... August? September? Anyway, right after I arrived in London, I ended up in Waxy's after a night out and about elsewhere. I really enjoyed it--I had a good night out with new city friends, and generally went home pleased with the place. But, I wasn't yet the active Yelper that I currently am, and I guess I never reviewed it!So here I am, six months later, after another fun night at Waxy's. This time I organized a big group to go there as part of a school-related event. I wasn't able to book a table, it being St. Patrick's day weekend, but it was the only bar I really considered going to, given it's huge space and ability to be Irish without offensive or overwhelming.We spent most of our time up in the "upper back" bar... I'm not sure which to call it. The main floor was quite full, with live music playing, but we were able to get a few tables, have a few drinks, and generally unwind from a long set of classes. The servers are always great here--getting drinks out fast and keeping the tables clean. There's never been a problem with the prices or anything like that, which is nice considering that it's in the heart of Piccadilly/Leicester Square and they could easily gouge on prices.I love this place because it's so big--you could sit in a different part of the building each night of the week. It gives it a funky, homey, pubby feel, despite being in "tourist country," and so large. Definitely a fave in the area... probably the only bar/pub/club I like in Leicester Square, actually!

q7KtYdviiyG7umGZARpUgg.text: A cavernous and sprawling Irish themed pub, I'm really not at all convinced by other reviewers' assertions this is old, representative of anything other than the centre of London, or traditional for any part of the world, least of all Ireland.A fine place for a few drinks, if you like Caffrey's or Guiness, but they'll be noisy ones, not quiet, and be prepared to be surrounded by tourists ( a number will have recently discovered they don't know their limits in terms of alcohol intake). Friendly staff ( if you're behaving yourself), often genuinely from the Emerald Isle. On my last visit, I got a number of free drinks as the bar person had poured them for another waitron but they'd not been wanted. Sweet. Be prepared to leave a trail of breadcrumbs between your perch and the loos though  it seems like a two hundred yard trek from upstairs to the bowels of the earth.

2LO4dhLjxG72pQuK4n7Xxw.text: I came here on St. Patrick's day, so my review of Waxy's will be based on that slightly unusual (read: really chaotic and crazy) experience.The drinks are expensive, but it's to be expected for a place in the middle of Leicester Square, I guess. A fiver for a Guinness is extortion, but that's London (and incidentally, still cheaper than in Dublin...).The pub is enormous, cavernous, and labyrinthine. There are tons of different floor levels, rooms, and nooks where you can hang out. And yes, there is a tree in the middle of the pub. Yesterday, every one of these spots was rammed and packed to the max, but I imagine it isn't always like this.The music was too loud and very Irish, ranging from The Pogues to The Script to fiddle and whistle folk songs. Not sure if that was also just a St. Paddy's day thing, but it made it so that you had to shout in order to speak to your friends who were standing less than a foot away from you.The bouncers in the club were essentially traffic control policemen, in that they barked at you if you stood in a walkway for more than 3 seconds. We had to plan where we were going before we went there, which was hard to do because we didn't know whether the destination would be more crowded than the place we were setting off from.The crowd was loud, rowdy, and very intoxicated. There were all kinds of invasions of personal space, lots of drunken jigging, and otherwise lots of...well...shenanigans. The above describes exactly the sort of bar I despise with a fiery passion. Yet, I had the most fun I've had in a long time at Waxy's. The insane crowd, overpriced drinks, and lack of any room to breathe all sort of worked for me. I guess everyone gets a free pass on St. Paddy's, though.

ewuriqRpjaAx0OI3zA9rLA.text: This pub is different to your average pub, yes, because of the big tree (as mentioned in the other reviews) it also is so big and there are so many doors, it can take a little while to find your friends if you are meeting them in there. I went on a Friday night and it was very busy to say the least, so to grab a table you need to get there really early, or be quick enough to grab one from people that are leaving. The atmosphere is great, although the music is very random (there may be a juke box somewhere) randomly you will hear an Irish song, and then you'll hear some random pop song! it is quite a strange experience and it can take you on an emotional roller coaster. They do serve food, but as it was so busy we only ordered chips, the chips were very nice :) It's in a great location so once you have finished here there are lots of other bars to move onto. Tip: it can get really busy so hold onto your hat when pushing past everyone.

F2ifh2L910MUm9kzeRdYAg.text: Great pub and very cool interior! Very crowded!! This is one of the must see pub and we had lots of fun here. There is also an Indian guy who carry his camera around, he is from the pub though, trying to earn some bucks by printing picture on key chains, etc.  Anyway our group photo was uploaded to the website event photo! Was a great night out.

VdZjpIZ53cFvmAjv9l2VSw.text: A nice pub with decent food, and ample space. They really need to work on their food workflow. When we ordered food they just asked the general location of the restaurant that we were seating.They didn't take a name or number or anything, which felt strange to me. Surely the person at the bar taking my order would not be delivering my food? How would they know where to deliver it to?Sure enough, they brought our food to the wrong table. The other table apparently wasn't sure what they ordered, but started picking up our food and eating it anyway. It looked like our food, so I asked the waitress about it, and then they just picked up the plates and put them on our table. Thanks for serving us food touched and eaten by other customers.

Nm0HyHb8LEZ4doGZv16tAQ.text: I love this pub, simply because it has a tree in the middle of it. No seriously it does! I think once upon a time it used to be a living addition to this world, but now, it's there for our viewing pleasure alone. If we were in Middle Earth, this scene would be so messed up! Having a dead body as a centre piece in a place of entertainment - Treebeard would be so p***ed!  Besides the dead Ent, you will also find old church pews, pole pulpits and retired confessional boxes (how apted!) Oh and did I mention it's an Irish pub?Years ago when I used to go here, it seemed so fresh & new, but perhaps it was I that was bright eyed and bushy tailed, and it had always been mediocre. That said, I am still very much attracted to this pub, even though I have to fight my way through hords of tourist to order my pint of extra cold.I would suggest that it's best avoided during the weekend, but if you must venture in, be prepared to queue at one of the many bars (I think there are three), even if you just pop in for a pre-lunchtime quickie!

wTn4PKPEPXiV3REE0dg1_Q.text: Now Waxy's is a must visit! Even though its location is popular for tourists, there aren't many actually going.Don't think it is an empty and boring place, though. Au contraire! Fridays and Saturdays it's crowded w/ locals, as myself. At first look it may seem like a small place, but it is HUGE! You go downstairs, then you have this big hall, then you go upstairs - wow, a tree inside the pub! Pretty fantastic. Then downstairs again, wait, that's another room and another bar.. told you it was huge. Music is usually some oldies but goldies tunes. And when you're done looking around it's time to get a drink. A pear cider for me, thanks!

ODzqyPRDC8UhaQ6ojYaMfQ.text: Waxy O'Connor's is one of those places you see on TV and think "wow, that is so cool" - and it is even better in real life.  We had no idea what Waxy's was, ordered a beer at the entrance bar and started looking around, so many rooms and stairs that go down to even more rooms and more stairs and even cooler rooms.  The first night we were there they had an Irish musician singing on stage with a guitar and she sang classics.The beer is great, lots of selection, prices reasonable and food impressed - we just ordered chips, onion rings and potato wedges.  Since being in London we have gone back twice and I bet we will venture back again.

br2cEmhc-XiscNvWddqu3w.text: There are alsotrees decorating the interior, making an almost nice mood that caught me offguard. The friendliness of the place is fashioned by small rooms and differentlevels, so it is possible to enjoy a quieter drink away from the main barzones.

p9Dn6pe7QGt6KwsOK7HQiA.text: Cute place and Irish coffee was good. I found the bartenders to be indifferent as we sat there at the bar waiting to place our drink order. The male bartenders seemed to be taking care of the male patrons and ignoring us females. Maybe a bad night? Not sure.

V9m_BXcREW2FA-dOeszTLQ.text: Went in there as in the area, still looks good with all the levels, but no customers. I ordered a pint of Guinness £5.40 for it. No wonder it is empty. Never going back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Waxy O'Connor's - London, United Kingdom

bs18BjVcYs5_nPBN1HSndA.text: Classic Irish Pub with occasional sports shows on. That s why I came in actually, to watch a game. The place is big so you can show up with your group. But this place is kind of average. Well, it is well located, I mean conveniently located. It attracts a crowd of different types of people, reeaaaallly different. I would probably never go back but again it can be convenient when you need a place, central london, where to meet.. Thats it.

HJxltTDXFPtuH0b04clllA.text: I came here with my friends after getting turned away from Experimental Cocktail Club because one of our group was wearing flip flops (whoops). We wanted a bar that we could get into that wasn't horribly touristy, so Alex S's review convinced me to check out Waxy O'Connor's- and I am glad we did! This place is quite the experience. It is gigantic, with tons of different winding underground rooms, multiple bars, live music, and a giant tree in the middle. What's not to love? The place was fairly packed for a random Tuesday night, and the beers were flowing. A great spot for a drink if you're in the area.

Igr_ZRtakp7ZhtQDNFJijw.text: We asked our waiter at a different pub for a recommendation. He told us about this place and said it was the most beautiful pub he'd ever seen - and he wasn't lying! We came on a Tuesday afternoon and it was almost empty, but it's just so awesome to see. You gotta check it out. The ham and cheese croquettes were yummy, and we drank bottled cider. Good service and great experience!

dniYDM0D8IO66wWlMGpkOA.text: Amazing!! What a cool bar! Seems so small from the outside but it's huge. Lovely people, staff and good sing a long music. Moderate prices for that area as well. Definitely gonna come back to this one!

photos.caption: Photo of Waxy O'Connor's - London, United Kingdom

9uRaqFOo2wGmX3KIWnkgeQ.text: This bar is huge and spans street to street! It is usually quite busy and I find they never have enough bar staff which is frustrating, and depending on your luck some of them just don't care about working speedily, so get 2 drinks at once to save trips to the bar. You can hire private rooms for events which is usually my reason for going. I'm a particular fan of the quirky mirrors in the toilets, very aesthetically pleasing!

_tXU0PItaPWESpnIFjn_mw.text: Awesome irish pub with a really cool decoration and ambience. I really recommend "the lot" (a board with lots of snacks) it costs £20.- and has a good variety of snacks in it. the egg is just awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Waxy O'Connor's - London, United Kingdom. "The Lot" for 20.-

6bdo6t9dOpXtjUBhjg32Ng.text: Cool bar with a lot of character and cool vibe. The only negative thing was a extremely rude and aggressive guard who shout at us when we were walking from one area to the other because, apparently, stoping for more than one second is not allowed in this bar.

ZNUl6nHs6WcpxF73IgVoyw.text: Oh my how did I only make it to this place earlier this month! Where the hell have I been living?! Under a rock?? Honestly, total mistake! It's soooo cool! I'm biased because I love Irish people, but what a damn good night out this place is! I went on a Friday night and they had a live music set on which was great. Some of the songs weren't what you could say Irish and a bit poppy, but who cares, we were loving it. The beer obviously helped and the prices weren't too shabby for this! The only thing that was annoying was when the barmaid tried to get us to pay for a drink we never ordered. That could have put a dampener on the night, but once we simpered out the confusion, we put it behind us and started dancing!  It gets busy with reservations but maybe it was just because Christmas was around the corner and people wanted to have their work parties! Anyhow we managed to get a great spot and you can easily spend a whole night here dancing!

DVFjvBmgSJqj8H-BZZ4Ktg.text: Great music, lots of different beers, nice staff and omg, what a tree !Definitely recommend that pub !

zShsqtzSYTXsZP9lKWRNKw.text: Great cozy and quirky bar, right in the centre. Perfect for groups and just 2 of you. Loads of cute corners and bars on different levels. Highly recommend this for drinks and food. The Porky burger was fingerlickin' good!

5G4evh9LU2q-3igWA8LsJw.text: Waxy o'Connors is good fun. The music is varied and sometimes live, the vibe is chillaxed and then gets a lot livelier as the night goes on and there's enough room to dance!The decor is on point - where else in London have you seen a tree in a pub? It's also big enough (there are three floors) that you don't get trampled on or don't spend your night waiting at the bar to order drinks. Having said that, there are loads of cosy little alcoves in this pub too so it's good for big and small groups.A round of drinks (wine, beers, cider) for four people came to £14 in central London. Nuff said.This place is a great laugh and has the right balance of not pretentious, but not trashy - which is a hard feat in central London. If you're in the area, are on a budget and don't fancy going to one of the gazillion poncy, soulless bars around central London, this pub is a good bet.

3iaqESoDlp73SX9dmfEqFQ.text: This "hole" is a MUST. And I say "hole" for a reason!This place is like a Hobbit Hole and the cottage from Snow White had babies!It's charming and filled with personable staff. There's live music and charming detailing throughout.Go go go go. You won't regret it ;)

Yhg7PhmM2fm6m6j7-poqCg.text: A fun pub to grab drinks and even a bite to eat around Piccadilly Circus. The first time you come you have to walk around inside to discover all the pub has to offer like a tree...They do take bookings so if you are planning to go during a busy time call ahead.After a long day of walking it is a great place to recharge with a few pints.

lZzsHAmOxA2rGQbCEs--xQ.text: This place is tremendous.  There is nothing more that needed to be said.  I came with a group of friends and nearly got lost.  The rating of four stars is generously given for a place to get beers in what is a neighborhood tourist area but it makes sense with the polite service.  The only food we can comment on was "the lot" and it was typical bar fare with nothing to write home about.

O7BYkTsfOrEqlESxp8EHZQ.text: Me and my friend went for a GNO to Waxy o'Connors as it has been highly recommended from our peers. Upon arrival, we were rudely greeted by two bouncers who without judgment, immediately assumed that we were extremely intoxicated and denied our entry into the pub. Because we were so rudely denied, we asked the bouncer his reasoning on the rejection. Without doubting his excuse, he said my friend was too drunk (she's been sober for 5 years) and refused an explanation. We were extremely disappointed at the lack of hospitality and honestly,humanity, that was executed at this bar. As we walked away, the bouncer mimicked a "jacking off" hand gesture over and over, calling us bitches and making us extremely uncomfortable. We will not be returning as we feel this is a reflection of not only the sick humans working the pub, but also the owners who allowed this disgusting behavior to happen. Needless to say, we will never come back and will recommend that none of our friends do the same. Get your shit together. Fucking assholes.

iQ6Gph1HkXu1mJQWkcLliQ.text: This place is really pretty impressive.  The entrance is a little deceiving, it's larger that it first appears.  I recommend going down to one of the lower bars if you can find a place to sit!  We came in on a Sunday evening and it was packed.  They have traditional British and Irish food with a higher end flair and quality.  The beer selection is a mix of English and Irish beers and cider with  some imports in tap.  They also have bottled imports but I rarely drink bottled imports when traveling.  I had a puffed pastry pie, very British, with venison.  I'm not a fan of traditional British food but this was really pretty good.  There were other traditional pub options that also looked very appetizing.  I had a good conversation about Irish independence with the bartender which was very interesting!  The live music was excellent and really added to the over all appeal.A good place to go but be aware it will likely have a lot of people!

photos.caption: Photo of Waxy O'Connor's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Waxy O'Connor's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Waxy O'Connor's - London, United Kingdom

AkYQDP49oDNTgydXNU2zVA.text: There's not much to say about Waxy O'Connor's. It is a truly great pub. They've got a great selection of drinks and the ambience is excellent. Oh, AND THEY HAVE A TREE GROWING INSIDE!!It's usually busy, often full of tourists because it's right next to Leicester Square and Soho but that has never put me off.

xT1uBjbxhNeIT5Q7_gvNPg.text: I love this place!  Multiple levels. Really cool decor. The trees in the middle of the bar are fantastic. There was a good band playing up in he little loft at the end of the bar tonight. Good beer choices that seem on par with other options in the pubs around town. If you're from the states this will probably be different than any place you've been before. Totally worth stopping by for a pint!

H7vhqM2BUqo2bAseRGc_vw.text: We really loved visiting Waxy O'Connors! It is located in Chinatown, just up from Picadilly Circus. At first glance it doesn't seem like much, but once you enter down the steps it ends up being a sizeable pub with multiple levels. It also offers live music. Food must be ordered at the bar and it will be delivered later. Like most places abroad, the food here is great. The is more hands off, but that is somewhat expected within a pub. Very cool hangout spot when in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Waxy O'Connor's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Waxy O'Connor's - London, United Kingdom. Veggie burgers, fries, wings
Photo of Waxy O'Connor's - London, United Kingdom. Menu

160HE8uMnv1ZZEljCefhpA.text: Food was cold and VERY mediocre. Not to mention it only arrived an hour late after I asked what was taking so long.. (we were #28, Kitchen) We are Always optimistic when reading negative reviews bc we want to give every place the benefit of the doubt. Should have taken it as a sign no one else was eating here. Lesson learned.

DfbDSLNgaqTzt67jNWssPg.text: This is the BEST pub if you are looking for a true Irish pub experience. It is so unique! Don't let the storefront entrance fool you... you enter into a maze of charm, woodwork and brick decor underground. The only negative is the location. It's nestled in a crowded area that doesn't have the charm of other London areas.

3J98VQWzK7_h7hrr6rg76g.text: In honor of St. Patrick's day!! I could keep this brief. And to a point I will, and to a point I will not.The coolest bar I have (in my lifetime) been to. I know I still have a lot of traveling to do and more places to find but this place... built around a tree has like 3... maybe 4 (I really don't remember) different bar areas to ensure you get the drinks you need quickly. Perhaps the word need isn't the right word.Everyone is happy dancing and singing and even being an American I was able to pick up on some of the choruses and sing along and always dance along. I love that they covered Metallica's Whiskey in the Jar O ;)We met dozens of people, such a friendly lot and everyone got along great. I can't think of what more you could want. Just joy at its core.THE VERDICT:If you only get to go to one bar while you are in London, I say go here. Friday, Saturday or Sunday night... doesn't matter any of those nights you will experience a fun loving crowd and be amazed by the tree that represents the roots that bring us all together for one remarkable night. Alex why a five-star... because it is freaking St. Paddy's day punk!

WoY32LGqTQdcZLSQfj6V3Q.text: Love this place.  It's right next to the "Times Square" of London, but don't let that fool you.  This place is far removed as being a tourist trap. You order at the bar and sit wherever you want and they bring the food out to you.  We had a burger and a meat pie. Yes, a meat pie.  I've been wanting to try one of these forever, and I just never got around to it. Until now that is!  Service was great, and everyone here was very friendly. They also have a tree theme going on, as if a giant tree is growing into the bar.  It's pretty cool.  Overall, I really enjoyed this place and would highly suggest seeking it out if you're looking for good food and drink within London.

photos.caption: Photo of Waxy O'Connor's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Waxy O'Connor's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Waxy O'Connor's - London, United Kingdom

_7y-db0q_Soy3XBaTyxh9A.text: My husband and I spent a week in London and one of the "requirements" while we were there was to go to an English pub, have a couple of pints and some fish and chips.  My husband chose this particular location, and made sure there was something I would eat/drink on the menu.  We arrived and the place was pretty busy.  We headed upstairs because we wanted food and many of the pubs that we had popped into over the course of the week had food upstairs.  Turns out there was no need to go upstairs, but it was nice anyway as it was a bit away from the hustle and bustle.  We sat at the table for a bit and perused the menu before figuring out you have to go to the bar to order both drinks and food.  My husband went downstairs, ordered our food and beverages, and paid.  He showed back up with our drink and a number so that when our food was ready they would know where to find us.  Drinks were good and reasonably priced.  The food arrived in a relatively short amount of time.  My husband enjoyed his fish and chips  My chicken burger was just okay.  The fried chicken taste was good, but it desperately needed some sort of sauce like a bbq, mustard, or curry.  The fries were fine.  They were reasonably hot and modestly crispy.  After eating we walked around the pub which is actually really cool and quite huge.  I kind of wish we had eaten in the room with the tree once we saw it.  Overall, the food was decent.  The drinks were solid and the price was right.

photos.caption: Photo of Waxy O'Connor's - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips
Photo of Waxy O'Connor's - London, United Kingdom. Chicken burger

Kzq5zXbS1B3elFXUg-brPA.text: One funky little spot! Looks like something out of a Tim Burton movie! We stumbled upon this while hanging out in the west end. Nice little pub that seems to never end. Eclectic as all get out! The service in London does leave a little to be desired. You have to flag down a server only to be told you must order at the bar. Fine, ordered and seated. We got a round and then submitted our food order. My hubby is taking this fish and chips very seriously. I went for a chicken sandwich. Not sure if they served coke or Pepsi but the food was good and the location was pretty cool.

photos.caption: Photo of Waxy O'Connor's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Waxy O'Connor's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Waxy O'Connor's - London, United Kingdom

AbPsKQhuAaE6RVDaHe5c5Q.text: Only had 7 hours in the city due to layover - made our way here due to the reviews posted. Have to agree this is one of the best Irish Pubs I've been been to hands down. The staff was super friendly. This place has a great vibe and is so large that you can be part of the action or sneak of to a quieter spot. Loved the atmosphere and the Fish and Chips!!!

j6xy3TVAsf5c7MXxZouDrw.text: Loved the atmosphere, people, food, and beer here.I had a flight starting with Crafty(?) IPA (my fav), center in pic is Guinness-like, and the last is Guinness. Fish & chips were on spot. I love crispier fries so these had the krinkles which make them 100x more enjoyable to me than regular steak fries. It came with smashed peas- I as excited to try, but it was a little cold to really enjoy.The guys behind he bar were all  helpful as this was still our first day in London. The place is really good looking and lots of cozy places to have a good time with friends or privacy with a date.My husband also had the chicken pie- which was to die for. Gravy, smash, seasonal veg (which was some kind of kale-like green). Wow, was that comforting.  After being up 30 hours for a flight from the states (we couldn't sleep) and then walking around London- this out us comfortably to bed.

photos.caption: Photo of Waxy O'Connor's - London, United Kingdom. Fish and Chips, with mashed peas
Photo of Waxy O'Connor's - London, United Kingdom. Beer Flight - L2R- Crafty IPA (yum!), some stout, and Guinness.

NdehqtYGTLuuW7VOZjCWtw.text: Had we not had a friend take us there, I don't know if I ever would have found it! Located just at the entrance into Chinatown, you go down a set of steps to almost an entirely different world. A fantastically decorated and a little Irish pub. The staff was fantastic and the beer was the perfect temperature. Do yourself a favor when in London, go to Waxy's!!!!

WlgC2QidgUFQK22DTyfpaQ.text: Wow, what an interesting, charming, confusing, labyrinthine place. It definitely seems like it popped out of Lord of the Rings. It has this fantastically alive vibe, like the patrons should be wearing deerskin boots and have swords or bows strung across their back... Like there should be a bard in a corner, or a ranger near a fireplace. Imagine, if you will... a multi-story pub, with trees and vines interspersed throughout. And then some rooms open into others, other rooms have two or three steps that go up into alcoves; this place is to big that it even has several bars. But not all bars had people behind the counters. And the tables didn't have numbers... I think that was something you received once ordering food. I don't know, maybe they just didn't want to serve us? I went to order, and they asked me where I was sitting. I recited a particular land mark near our table, that I thought was unique to the room we were sitting in, only to have the bartender tell me that several rooms has the same marker. So I ended up giving up, because we were just supposed to stop by for a quick drink before going to the Palace to see The Cursed Child. And I even got lost trying to find my companion on the way back. I'm not joking. This place is like a maze, especially when it's crowded, and you're mind is a bit preoccupied. Many rooms look similar, and everything is in a semi-darkness. I don't even want to imagine how confusing it would be to navigate if you were actually drinking.I definitely want to come back here if I'm in the area for further exploration!

d1qEC25lJd24M2EE8Wy2kw.text: Grabbed a pint before going to the theater. The space is huge with multiple levels and multiple bars. The space is really cool inside with an old tree in one of the bars. I'm sure this spot gets extremely busy the later it gets.

photos.caption: Photo of Waxy O'Connor's - London, United Kingdom

mgRk6m8WtQqTlnAhJnu9OA.text: Only had a beer. No food. Bar with lots of character. Mostly underground so if you are claustrophobic, think twice. Friendly staff. None English.

K1PPYCf_NjMdPWMBUsyf5A.text: Let's start with the fact that you pay before you eat: so fast food. Then they got the order wrong, asked for an explanation and the girl who took my order didn't know what to say ( how can you take orders and not know?) and told me to ask another waiter. No one apologized for the mistake and I had to order again, and pay again of course! That being said, the food and the beer were good ( nothing special for an Irish pub tho)

1uOEvP-W6euufaGpu2fL2A.text: So much fun!!!!!Reminds me of the Quay's in Galway. Multiple levels, great crowd, lots of tvs... will definitely come back when I visit London next :)

XcQrvHH4Q4mJRd4HqzmSVQ.text: This place is awesome! Love the decor old church sitting,  it reminds me of the Harry Potter movies has food and large beer selection. A must see for a stop off drink after a long day of London tours.

photos.caption: Photo of Waxy O'Connor's - London, United Kingdom

dgkFR8Afr22DqMrEz6yaxA.text: 50% off whiskey on Wednesday night's! Absolutely great underground pub. Make sure you go all the way down under. Live music in November!

czQhOUWap6vAtiwoo_6wzg.text: We tried to go in here on a monday afternoon with our 17 year old daughter but they wouldn't let us. We found that the rules vary from place to place.

5Z_oGhSyfl3aBzjNN-7xRg.text: Very fun spot to catch a live band! We loved winding our way down the multiple levels to a hidden alcove where we could see the musicians.

b6--ngb4lUHcjUYR1sqHqQ.text: Tourist trap Irish themed bar with terrible ownership. So many places around to get a nice pint. Why get one here?

b3XgrPz1r0AIGc9CCqaWhg.text: I've visited this bar on my past two trips to London.  What a great time we had!  The staff are very friendly in a really fun 'tree house' atmosphere.  Will certainly be returning on the next trip - hopefully to see some live music as well.

RCQ5cw8FmEFlA86RUHJNrA.text: I finished an incredible St. Patrick's Day at Waxy O'Connor's. Crowded it definitely was, but the crowd was amicable overall, agreeably inebriated, and displaying that type of raucous anticipation that precedes any "night too good to remember". Granted, this multi-layered party house is not going to transport you to the nostalgic shores of the Liffey, but it does a great job of taking you away from the on-and-off drudgery of wintertime in London.If you do come here on St. Paddy's Day with a giant green hat, I must warn you, BEWARE: Everyone will be trying to steal it off you!There are four different levels off-set from each other, each with its own bar and space for a healthy crowd. There's plenty of stout to go 'round, too. There are also "trees" decorating the interior, creating an almost fantastical ambiance that caught me off guard. Or maybe it was all the Guinness and cider...

e46Iogwcsu2JzkTEpt7j0A.text: We hit Waxy's twice on our visit to London.  If you are looking for the classic British pub, then you should probably check out some of the smaller places.  Waxy's is HUGE!  I love that you can sit with the crowd, or change floors and find a more quiet booth.  Good food and great brews!  Going to try Waxy's Little Sister next time.

LDg0wGcVrAsI0Wj8V1cTWw.text: TREE HOUSE ADVENTURES!!  WOOHOO!    Feels like a kid again... going around the maze!

ZYUrkB0LaUs535dgGAUeaQ.text: loud. busy. crazy. loud. loud. claustrophobic. loud.  decent drinks, though.

UFNYPy33Ib_TqkxMK9Ugeg.text: Waxy O Connor's is wonderfully deceptive from the outside. I popped in here for a drink on a Saturday afternoon thinking that it would be your average run of the mill pub. I was certainly in for a pleasant surprise! It reminds me a little of a magical make believe world - something out of Lord of the Rings perhaps as there is a huge tree in the middle with lots of different levels with little seating areas. It sounds sad but I wouldn't be surprised if I saw little goblins wandering around in here. OK - maybe I am sad. The ceilings are huge and I love the rustic wood furniture. It is always busy in here - in the afternoons you can usually find a cosy seat but on an evening, especially the weekend, you will struggle as it is always packed out. The music is brilliant - of course, you get your Irish favourites which are good fun and they then play classic 80's, rock and pop. The staff are brilliant - they work the bar well and are great fun yet efficient. You can also get a lovely pint of Beamish.

TYMiLxmb-Gj7UpJb96qmbw.text: Mixed reviews from everyone else but i like it.I would not go in every week but I tink they have made an effort and having something this unusual in the centre of London is spot on.It is downstairs from a small doorway and then it spralls in frond of you -much larger than you would expect with a great big tree in the middle -takes your breath away the first time.Not got much else going for it expensice gassy lagers and undrinkable London beer.

p9E-pL36yFazU_rtVH9rAA.text: All I have to say about this, the one reason I like it so much, which you'll think is strange... it has a massive tree in the centre of it!! It's not real but it's so cool. The drink prices are good, but it does get very busy, so get there early. It is a pub with a really nice atmosphere.

I8tpQzo3lsEshdE3Voa1TA.text: Met up with a friend at Waxy's last night, great place, good atmosphere. The great part about Waxy's is that there is a huge tree in the middle of the bar. It Irish theme is great and definately a place I will go to again!

psoDno4_-809urUKF8zAbg.text: I visited Waxy's for the first time tonight - it's decent enough for its surroundings but I did find it rather overcrowded (even though this was only Thursday evening) even though the place is huge. Given the fact that most of the complex of rooms is underground I also found it a bit oppressive rather expensive too - £3.70 for a regular brand of lager that wasn't very cold either.

LNCYIrc7zM213yuJXdOA1g.text: An Irish pub with a fantastic atmosphere- great fun. I came here once on St Patric's day- it was too busy, we had to leave, but normally it is perfect. A lively, friendly and fun pub.

16ih5-yD-PycE_pqJmlGgg.text: As a general rule I hate faux Irish pubs, but I always enjoy Waxy's - not for any Irishness it offers, but the fact it feels like a cornucopia of different places all under one roof. Small bar areas abound on different levels, giving lots of character, topped off by the famed tree. Typically expensive for a London pub though.

OI_Ng-rrnEVANYeTiW8kAQ.text: Waxys is an unusual pub in the centre of London, just off Leicester square. In appearance, it tries to be Irish, but it is difficult to see the connection once inside. The interior is fantastic, it resembles a rabbit warren with all the twists & turns and different floors & levels (it can be quite confusing when you have had a lemonade or two though!) The bar has big screen tvs & shows major sporting events. Drinks are priced similar to other central london establishments & closing time is 11.30. If you want to party on into the night, you will have to find another watering hole, but as waxy's is in such a central location, it wont take you long to find a late bar to continue partying

hmPzxwL9VojvpKOjLZDUKg.text: Waxie O'Connors in Piccadilly is a great venue to go for a party. it is huge, spread on god knows how many levels with hell knows how many bars. you can choose where you wich to drink and the theme you want to enjoy while you do so. In the middle of the place stands a huge fake tree and most of the furniture is wooden. great table where 10 or more people can sit and there platters to share are just so good you always have to order twice as more as you normally need. the nachos melt on yout tongue.they have a good range of beer and if you don't stay at the first bar, you shouldn't need to wait for too long before being served.they also play pretty good music although it may be a bit loud but that doesn't really matter as the place is so huge that you can take as many friends as you want in and just dance and have fun.make sure you have got your idea with you though, they may not let you in otherwise

zQDFaDLvJSkgPD2jYaR8VQ.text: Typical irish themed pub- Went here on saturday when the rugby was on and it was absolutely heaving. Lively atmosphere, nice drink selection although service was a little slow to say the least.

xoKXgsNNsCyBWK9l36JnlA.text: Don't be daft. It's quirky if you're mad. But it's a bit of a weatherspoon type affair and always rammed with out-of-town 6th Formers on a school field trip to London necking the Fosters. Only if you're desperate. VERY desperate.

sm1LNHneiUph6m6ytigNNQ.text: A large, yet traditionally decorated and dimly lit Irish pub, within walking distance of both Piccadilly Circus and Leicester Square tube stations. The venue boasts four bars, spread over even more floors. Food, which is traditional in nature and generally good value for money (in terms of quantity), is also available. There is ample seating space, however food is generally served at a separate seating area (the lowest floor) away from the main bars, which tend to become crowded as the night goes on and the music gets louder. The drinks are served with a smile and well priced for such a central location. Waxy's serves as a great place to catch up with friends, drink with colleagues after work, or for drinks before moving onto a club in Soho or the surrounding area.

uNq2BY2AQzgrcsK2VWAo9A.text: Waxy'sWaxy's is a cavernous Irish Themed pub in the heart of the west end. It get's packed out with the after work crowd on Friday evenings, and I'm not kidding when I say packed. Think sardine. Still, it's better than going to an O'neils. Just.

SmSRW3lqAGylLg3vEL7wUg.text: Great place but crowded !Waxy O'Connor's is a really nice place, situated just next to Leicester Square, so obviously it is very, very crowded... get there early, or you'll stand in the middle of the mass for the rest of the night. The place is really cool too, it is on four levels, decorated like any pub, but in light colored wood... in the middle is a huge tree, which is quite impressive. They also have a good selection of beers,... of course !

zCx7sB9-xgp0K86tvwhJTw.text: Packed. Good music. Not authentic, but it has multiple bars so you don't need to wait around for a drink.

v7tK1e7S7-FupxpvW7rhqw.text: I think I went to a bar eerily similar to Waxy O'Connor's in New Haven, Connecticut once. The crowd was having a great time and it's loud and packed.  The 'gummy bear' pink cocktail I was given was yummy but in context, it was a few pubs into the night.  I did like the little nooks that overlooked the sea of people, and the random tree.

_oNcTsG65NSVic_S-jOIdQ.text: Whenever someone visits me from out of town, I drag them off to Waxy's. It's a large and very likeable Irish pub but it's the odd interior that makes it special; stained glass windows, fireplaces, strange wood carvings and a massive tree that appears to be growing right through the heart of the pub.The warmth of the place is created by small rooms and different levels, so it is possible to enjoy a quieter drink away from the main bar areas.They offer a full lunch and dinner menu, show major sports matches on big screens throughout the pub and they have live music on some nights.

fHHtAvSheK3j1CFG6M7LWg.text: This pub is amazing.  I love how you can get lost just going to the loo.  There are so many different levels and room.  I love all the tree branches inside.  It makes you feel like you are burrowed under a tree in the roots.If you come here don't stop at the bar in the front without exploring the maze in the back.

G3k76__TkS-dxzf7iSxW0A.text: Now if you want a pint in one of London's oldest boozers with historical artifacts, this is the place to be. They have the very first Guinness logos on display, the oldest bottles of wine and some of the architecture is still standing since the 1800s. The entire place if made of wood. Several floors and there is a mini balcony retreat right above the second bar for those of you that enjoy people watching. A pint of Grolsch wont set put a hole in your wallet.

urQV0znV_mg27eLkkM5FDw.text: This is good if you are in a big group, as its massive. Its also good if you are totally hammered, as its quite maze like inside so its easy to get lost, which can be an exciting adventure at the end of a long night. Apart from those plus points, its probably a bit too loud and full of teenagers and students to go to very often.

rPFNUuy36SyYxM7zDs19eQ.text: Nice place, the interior is impressive but the drinks are really expensive.

GFeBS-oufoyMk1qW6TzkKQ.text: Well it's huge quite frankly - I can't think of a bigger pub I've been to in London, or in fact anywhere come to think of it. But despite it being so big, it can have quite an intimate feel as it has lots of little nooks and crannys and would appear to have been designed by a madman at first glance but it all actually really works to give a venue big enough to get as many people as you like in, but small enough to gossip quietly in the corner. Good atmosphere overall, though it can get really quite busy and you're a braver man than me if you try and get in there on St Patrick's day. Oh yes, and it's already been said but there's a tree in the middle, which is a bit odd but does give it something rather unique!

yX8gskcnXSUUohyFVVBVOQ.text: Yes - the tree in the centre of the ub is the oddest thing you'll encounter but don't let that stop you wandering. Check the bathrooms out too as well as all the various hiding places around the bar. It has cosy areas as well as a couple of main gathering areas. I found it got crowded quickly and it was hard to move around and once the live music started in the balcony area over the sunken bar, it was impossible to hear anyone but what the heck - the atmos was amazing!

aSilaJaIgnFOAfFstMc8pQ.text: The Waxy O'Connor's of today compared to the place it was, say, ten years ago are two very different things and I, for one, really miss the old Waxy's. I remember the first few times I was there being awestruck by the massiveness of the places with all the fantastic nooks and crannies, the really gorgeous big beautiful bar and that amazing beech tree right in the center of the establishment. It got crowded quickly in the evenings, but if you got there early enough you could find a seat, and the food they served was really very good. The music they played was all Irish and the atmosphere had a really good vibe. Now, or at least the last time I went to Waxy's, which was sometime in the last year or so, it feels more like a typical Leicester Square bar/nightclub. The music is more typical and LOUDER, the crowd feels more like they are there for a meat market than for a good hang-out and in general the place just feels like it's lost it's SOUL. There are even bathroom attendants, which is also typical of the area, but so ridiculously unnecessary! Why Waxy's have you forsaken me?! I used to love going here, thought of it as a treat, but now I can't even bring myself to step inside. What a shame.

MHJhSE3D-7aHcuZnPzcMvQ.text: It's actually spelled Waxy O'Connor's, but never mind. One of the most interesting looking pubs in London that I've come across. The tree is amazing and it has two stairs sweeping up to and around it from either side. There are a few areas where a corridor or a few steps will lead you into a side area, and even one bit that takes you to a very compact balcony space overlooking one of the main bars. There's usually someone hording it thoughThe website has a 'virtual tour' to give you a flavour of the place. It does get very noisy and extremely crowded so don't walk in with a headache. Seating is at a premium and you need to be prepared to stand. You can get into the place from either side of the block: there is one entrance from Rupert Street and another one on Wardour Street. They're are not that easy to find, look for the overhead sign - a round one I think?

Pgx3OmU_bNmJm8IYthnSWA.text: Wow, this Irish pub just off China Town and close to Soho is absolutely massive. Like a labyrinth it has several levels, all made from dark wood and feeling very cozy, even if some of the ceilings are a bit too small for this 6'4'' tall guy! More charming than most Irish pubs the bar is well managed and has lots of room for groups. Drinks are the standard high price that is, unfortunately, standard in the area but if the venue makes up for this. Great venue for visiting tourists or for those that fancy a quick pint whilst uptown. They also show certain sports games and sometimes have dj's which, for either, is great if you're into that sort of thing.

WYg9xqfnp1j51cBTDn3eQg.text: GO TO WAX O'CONNOR'S ON THE FOURTH OF JULY  IF YOU'RE IN LONDON-TOWN - it's awesome - Happy Loss of Empire Day Everyone!!

9y2NyoNeRbB3DQJPBND5mA.text: Stepping down into Waxy O'Conners is like stepping through into a microcosm, worlds away from you'll find yourself considering The World Outside. It's eclectic and characterful, occasionally a live band, and everyone has their favourite spot. If Alice had needed a beer to settle her nerves after the Mad Hatter's tea party - you can imagine that this is the kind of pub you'd find in Wonderland. For mid-week drinks this place is hits the spot. Saturday nights do get busy, and I'd even go as far as using the term rammed. This pub sports a good crowd, good staff, great location, and brilliant design.

IDTrIhbQgi6KiMWEoSZL8g.text: Waxy's is always our meeting place in central London as it is close to both Leics Sq and Picadilly Circus tube stations. The bar staff here are usually pretty good which is handy as the pub gets very busy at the weekends. If you are meeting your mates here then I advise you to agree on a bar to meet at as you will be lucky to get any mobile signal due to most of the bar being underground.

WmMl-8QQTG23CGewk_ySWg.text: The Waxy O'Connor is a pub really well situated in one street very near to Leicester Square. The pub is massive and has a lot of small areas with different decorations. I love the area that is decorated as a forest.They serve food and is quite good stuff, I really like the nachos and they have special menus sometimes (like typical Irish dishes).On the downside the staff is sometimes a bit rude and there the doormen are not very friendly too. At the weekends is quite difficult to find a seat but the ambiance is really nice and is a good place to have some drinks.

IIgNOx8WiDLCfhzXvB6xiQ.text: Huge Irish pub in the centre of town. Waxy's is a great place to get a beer or have a bite to eat. It's huge, but it is often packed, it's popular weekday evenings and especially at weekends. There are a number of bars inside serving the usual draught selections. Look out for the tree in the middle of the pub, it's worth a visit.

z-rK37_r43gh6orUcPqohA.text: Has to be one of the better Central London bars. As most people have said already the huge tree, and bar split over multiple floors, this really feels like an Aladdins cave of a bar. Reasonably priced and a good crowd, make this is a good place to stop for a drink on the way home.

yD8vIhxLcN8bsreP2TVaog.text: It is a very curious and interesting pub. The decor is the best about it, there is a huge tree right in the middle of the place. Typical Irish music and drinks that make you feel completed involved in the Irish culture. It is very popular among the West End workers, so pretty busy after 17:00 on weekdays, that is almost impossible to get a table, also Live sports are shown on big screens. On the weekends are pretty good, they play mostly Irish and Rock music and on Sunday there is live music.

FFJ6rT_tM0wV0447oXvRyQ.text: With 4 bars over 11 floors (although some of them are v v tiny) waxys is a great irish bar with loads of energy and atmosphere. its near picadilly and leicester square but if you go in the week and in the afternoons its not too busy.however best avoided on a satturday night unless you dont mind a wait, and dont even contemplate st patricks day!!The interior is really original and each room is themed from the tree room to the church room where you can drink your drinks from traditional church benches.Theres 11 floors to explore however some of them are very small and cosy and perfect for a small group to enjoy a drink by the fire.The food is good too and available all day, and theres a good choice of irish beers not just guiness!! Its a agreat place with a good theme and they have managed to avoid it being cheesy, its a must see!!
